nodes.bodyText:
For some reason, I can't add comments below this line... @benradey, any idea why that might be?
Anyway, my comments:
"Following is the comparison..." You can just change this to a title for the table. Alternatively, "the following table compares the structure of a DITA topic and a module."
I think that this table is kind of misleading, though...I'm not real sure what you're trying to show here. A module, ideally, should be structured like a DITA topic, even though it doesn't use XML. There's no meaningful difference between <title>Topic title</title> and = Topic title. And you should ideally have a short description, body, and related links.
Also, technically, you can have nested topics within a topic. You're just not supposed to according to the Mod Docs guidelines.

nodes.bodyText:
Again, I can only add comment up to this line. Strange.
"A module, in modular documentation, is defined as topic-specific structured informational content written in the specified syntax, stored in a file, that can be published on its own and as a part of a larger document in {ProductShortName}."
=>
"A module is a piece of structured content that can stand on its own or as part of a larger document. Generally, a module is stored in its own file. Asciidoc is the source language for modules in {ProductShortName}."

"The following are the properties of a module:" => "A module has the following properties:"

Self-contained and standalone look redundant to me.
In Self-contained, you switch from talking about the module to talking about the user. Also uses passive. Feels strange. I suggest you change to: "A module contains all the necessary information that a user needs to achieve a goal. A module explains a concept, provides a procedure to perform a task, or presents reference information."
You have an attribute in the module: {ProductShortName}. If you're removing the attributes file, you need to hard code this. Why are you removing the attributes file reference?
